title: Modify the ONNX Upsample mode "linear" -> "bilinear"
body_html:
The ONNX has upsample mode "bilinear", and other frameworks ONNX converter (like Tensorflow, CoreML) use "bilinear" keyword.

In onnx-tensorflow will raise this error:

RuntimeError: Upsample without nearest or bilinear is not supported in Tensorflow.

In onnx-coreml will raise this error:

mode = mode_convert[node.attrs["mode"].decode("UTF-8")]
KeyError: 'linear'

Change the mode keyword will fix these bug.

This has been discussed in issue: #12647 and pr: #12648, perhaps it is not a bug of pytorch.
body_text:
The ONNX has upsample mode "bilinear", and other frameworks ONNX converter (like Tensorflow, CoreML) use "bilinear" keyword.
In onnx-tensorflow will raise this error:
RuntimeError: Upsample without nearest or bilinear is not supported in Tensorflow.

In onnx-coreml will raise this error:
mode = mode_convert[node.attrs["mode"].decode("UTF-8")]
KeyError: 'linear'

Change the mode keyword will fix these bug.
This has been discussed in issue: #12647 and pr: #12648, perhaps it is not a bug of pytorch.
body:
The ONNX has [upsample mode "bilinear"](https://github.com/onnx/onnx/blob/master/docs/Operators.md#Upsample), and other frameworks ONNX converter (like Tensorflow, CoreML) use "bilinear" keyword.

In [onnx-tensorflow](https://github.com/onnx/onnx-tensorflow) will raise this error:
``` 
RuntimeError: Upsample without nearest or bilinear is not supported in Tensorflow.
```
In [onnx-coreml](https://github.com/onnx/onnx-coreml) will raise this error:
```
mode = mode_convert[node.attrs["mode"].decode("UTF-8")]
KeyError: 'linear'
```

Change the mode keyword will fix these bug.

This has been discussed in issue: https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/issues/12647 and pr: https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/pull/12648, perhaps it is not a bug of pytorch.
